name: Eminent domain trial
text:
[Section effective July 1, 2006.  For section effective until June 30, 2006, see above.]  The parties to the eminent domain action brought under this chapter shall be the administration as plaintiff and the lessees and all other necessary parties as defendants.  The administration does not have the burden of proof in establishing the fair market value of the leased fee interest being acquired.  Instead, all parties, including the administration, shall be given an opportunity to present evidence of the fair market value of the leased fee interest being acquired. [L 1983, c 203, §3; am L 1987, c 337, §16; am L 1988, c 104, §2; am L 1991, c 154, §1; am L 2005, c 196, §26(b)]
Case Notes
  Pursuant to this section, defendant, because defendant was a lessee of disputed property, was named as co-defendant in condemnation action; defendant had standing to move to set aside the action in which defendant was named a party.  77 H. 144, 883 P.2d 65.
